action.action-desc: Mr. Chabot (for himself and Ms. Velázquez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to simplify income tax compliance for small businesses, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Owners’ Tax Simplification Act of 2017.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Quarterly reporting of estimated tax payments.
Sec. 3. Aligning the filing thresholds for information reporting.
Sec. 4. Uniform standards for the use of electronic signatures for third-party disclosure authorizations.
Sec. 6. Treatment of cafeteria plans for employee-owners.
Sec. 7. Excluding from self-employment income net earnings less than amount required for Social Security quarters of coverage.
Sec. 8. Allowing a deduction for certain health insurance costs for self-employment tax purposes.
Sec. 9. No effect of voluntary withholding agreements on worker classification.
Sec. 10. Effect of voluntary training and group discount programs on worker classification.

section.header: Quarterly reporting of estimated tax payments

subsection.text: The table contained in paragraph (2) of section 6654(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking June 15 and inserting July 15, and
by striking September 15 and inserting October 15.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to installments due in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Aligning the filing thresholds for information reporting

subsection.header: Increasing the dollar threshold required for filing a 1099–MISC

paragraph.text: Subsection (a) of section 6041 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $600 and inserting $1,500.
Section 6041 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsections:

subsection.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2018, the dollar amount in subsection (a) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

paragraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2017 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subsection.text: If any dollar amount in subsection (a) (after being increased under subsection (g)) is not a multiple of $100, such dollar amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $100.

paragraph.text: The heading of subsection (a) of section 6041 of such Code is amended to read as follows: Payments exceeding threshold..

subsection.header: Increasing the dollar limit for remuneration for services and direct sales

paragraph.text: Paragraph (2) of section 6041A(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $600 and inserting $1,500.
Section 6041A of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsections:

subsection.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2018, the dollar amount in subsection (a)(2) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

paragraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2017 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subsection.text: If any dollar amount in subsection (a)(2) (after being increased under subsection (g)) is not a multiple of $100, such dollar amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $100.

subsection.header: Decreasing the dollar threshold required for filing a 1099–K; eliminating the transaction threshold
subsection.text: Subsection (e) of section 6050W of such Code is amended by striking only if and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting only if the amount which would otherwise be reported under subsection (a)(2) with respect to such transactions exceeds the dollar amount in effect for the taxable year under section 6041(a)..
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to returns for years beginning after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Uniform standards for the use of electronic signatures for third-party disclosure authorizations
section.text: Not later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary of the Treasury shall publish guidance to establish uniform standards and procedures for the acceptance of signatures in digital or other electronic form for purposes of—

paragraph.text: any request for disclosure of a taxpayer's return or return information under section 6103(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and
any power of attorney executed by a taxpayer.

section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Treasury will ensure that, for any refund or credit of overpayment of tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 transferred to an individual through electronic fund transfer, there is, prior to such transfer, a prenotification testing to verify recipient information and assist in preventing refund fraud.

section.header: Treatment of cafeteria plans for employee-owners

subsection.text: Subsection (g) of section 125 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding section 105(g), for purposes of providing qualified benefits under a cafeteria plan of an eligible employer (as defined in subsection (j)(5)) and for purposes of any prohibition on discrimination (including subsection (b)) with respect to a cafeteria plan—

clause.text: the term employee includes an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1) and any individual treated as a partner under section 1372(a),
an individual who owns the entire interest in an unincorporated trade or business shall be treated as his own employer, and
a partnership shall be treated as the employer of each partner who is an employee within the meaning of clause (i).

clause.header: Amounts excluded not to exceed earned income
clause.text: In the case of an individual treated as an employee by reason of subparagraph (A)(i), subsection (a) shall apply to amounts for an individual only to the extent that such amounts exceeds the individual’s earned income (as defined in section 401(c)(2)) derived from the trade or business with respect to which the cafeteria plan is maintained.

This paragraph shall apply in the case of any individual treated as a partner under section 1372(a), except that, for purposes of this subsection, such individual’s wages (as defined in section 3121) from the S corporation shall be treated as such individual’s earned income, and there shall be such adjustments in the application of this subsection as the Secretary may by regulations prescribe.

subparagraph.text: No deduction or credit shall be allowed to an employee under any section of this chapter for any amount excluded from gross income under subsection (a) by reason of this paragraph.

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 125(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

clause.text: In the case of a plan that covers one or more individuals described in clause (i) of subsection (g)(5)(A), the requirements of this paragraph shall be treated as met if the average employer contribution allocable to qualified benefits under the plan on behalf of individuals who are not qualified employees does not exceed 150 percent of the average employer contribution allocable to such benefits on behalf of individuals who are qualified employees.
In the case of a plan treated under clause (i) as meeting the requirements of this paragraph, subparagraph (C) shall not apply.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply with respect to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Excluding from self-employment income net earnings less than amount required for Social Security quarters of coverage

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 1402(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $400 and inserting the amount required under section 213(d) of the Social Security Act for a quarter of coverage for the calendar year in which such taxable year began.
Section 6017 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $400 and inserting the amount required under section 1402(b)(2).
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Allowing a deduction for certain health insurance costs for self-employment tax purposes

subsection.text: Subsection (l) of section 162 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking paragraph (4).
The amendment made by this section shall apply with respect to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017.

section.header: No effect of voluntary withholding agreements on worker classification
section.text: Section 3402(p) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Agreements under paragraph (3) may not be taken into account in determining whether any party to such agreement is an employee or an employer for purposes of any provision of this title.

section.header: Effect of voluntary training and group discount programs on worker classification

subsection.text: Chapter 79 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Effect of voluntary training and group discount programs on worker classification

subsection.text: For purposes of this title, the determination of whether an individual is an employee shall be made without regard to the following:

paragraph.text: Whether such individual is offered, and whether such individual accepts, voluntary training.
Whether such individual is offered, or takes advantage of, a discount on goods and services available by reason of such individual performing services.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall issue such regulations as the Secretary determines are necessary to carry out the purposes of this section.
The table of sections for chapter 79 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 7705 the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 7706. Effect of voluntary training and group discount programs on worker classification.
